movesets.name: Defensive

items.name: Eviolite
items.description: Boosts Defense and Special Defense of holder by 50% if it is an NFE Pokemon.

movesets.description:
Moves

Stealth Rock is the most important move on the set as it grants constant residual damage to the opposing team. Scald is the STAB of choice because of its reliable burn chance, and Stone Edge is Tirtouga's strongest STAB option, doing decent damage to most of the tier. Since most of the Pokemon in Little Cup rely on their items, Knock Off is a great option in the last moveslot to cripple these Pokemon. However, Aqua Jet allows Tirtouga to pick off damaged opponents later in the game.

Set Details

Solid Rock and Eviolite allow Tirtouga to take some weaker super effective attacks such as Hidden Power Grass from Murkrow and Drain Punch from popular Fighting-types, such as Timburr and Meditite. A Relaxed nature is optimal because Tirtouga is using both physical and special attacks, and it doesn't use its Speed much anyway.

Usage Tips

Setting up Stealth Rock early-game is Tirtouga's most important job. After that it works best as a pivot, using whichever attack is appropriate at the moment. If Tirtouga is using Aqua Jet, it is a good idea to save it for late-game to pick off damaged threats.

Team Options

Grass-types such as Ferroseed and Foongus can wall and status the Electric- and Grass-type Pokemon that threaten Tirtouga. Misdreavus and Spritzee are also great partners because they can eliminate the Fighting-types that threaten Tirtouga.

movesets.name: Shell Smash

items.name: Berry Juice
items.description: Restores 20 HP when at 50% HP or less. One-time use.

movesets.description:
Moves

Shell Smash is the main move of the set, allowing Tirtouga to outspeed most of the tier and boost its offenses to scary levels after just one use. Waterfall is Tirtouga's most reliable STAB attack, KOing most non-resisting Pokemon at +2. Stone Edge grants it dual STAB, offering a higher powered attack with qualms only in accuracy. Aqua Jet can be used to beat priority users, such as Pawniard and Carvanha, as well as Choice Scarf Pokemon that outspeed Tirtouga even at +2. However, Earthquake is an option for additional coverage, allowing Tirtouga to hit threats such as Croagunk that would otherwise wall the set.

Set Details

Berry Juice and Sturdy let Tirtouga survive two attacks from any Pokemon, allowing it to easily set up and sweep. An Adamant nature works best since Tirtouga already outspeeds most of the tier. A bulkier spread of 4 HP / 212 Atk / 12 Def / 76 SpD / 180 Spe with an Adamant nature, Eviolite, and Solid Rock instead of Sturdy is also viable because it lets Tirtouga set up safely even if Sturdy is broken. Lastly, Rock Slide can be used over Stone Edge if accuracy is more important than power.

Usage Tips

Tirtouga can start off as a lead so Sturdy is guaranteed to activate. But, an opposing team with full health usually can KO it before satisfactory damage is done. Tirtouga performs best sweeping late-game, when all of the enemy Pokemon have enough damage for it to nab the KOs. In order for this to happen, Tirtouga needs entry hazards off the field for Sturdy to remain intact. With Sturdy, Tirtouga can switch into any Pokemon with only attacking moves, activate Berry Juice, and set up Shell Smash for the sweep. If Sturdy is broken early-game, use the opponent's weaker attacks and entry hazards to Tirtouga's advantage and switch in at the right moment in order to activate Berry Juice.

Team Options

Since Tirtouga needs Sturdy intact to sweep, Pokemon such as Rapid Spin Drilbur and Defog Vullaby are good partners to keep entry hazards off the field. Defensive cores benefit Tirtouga because it can't switch in until it is ready to sweep. Grass-types such as Ferroseed and Foonguss synergize well with Tirtouga because they cover its weaknesses and spread status, making it easier for Tirtouga to switch in and set up. Lastly, Misdreavus and Spritzee are good partners because they handle Fighting-types that threaten this set.

moves.name: Ancient Power
moves.description: 10% chance to boost all stats by 1 stage.

moves.name: Aqua Jet
moves.description: The user always attacks first.

moves.name: Aqua Tail
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Attract
moves.description: Targets of the opposite gender are infatuated and have a 50% chance to do nothing.

moves.name: Bide
moves.description: Charges for 2-3 turns; returns double the damage received in those turns.

moves.name: Bite
moves.description: 10% chance to flinch.

moves.name: Blizzard
moves.description: 10% chance to freeze.

moves.name: Block
moves.description: The target cannot switch out.

moves.name: Body Slam
moves.description: 30% chance to paralyze.

moves.name: Brine
moves.description: Base Power doubles if foe's HP is 50% or less.

moves.name: Bulldoze
moves.description: Lowers target's Speed by 1 stage.

moves.name: Confide
moves.description: Lowers the target's Special Attack by 1 stage.

moves.name: Crunch
moves.description: 20% chance to lower Special Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Curse
moves.description: Does 1/4 of max HP damage per turn at the cost of half the user's max HP if the user is a Ghost. Boosts Attack and Defense and lowers Speed by 1 stage otherwise.

moves.name: Dig
moves.description: User is made invulnerable for one turn, then hits the next turn.

moves.name: Dive
moves.description: User is made invulnerable for one turn, then hits the next turn.

moves.name: Double Team
moves.description: Boosts evasion by 1 stage.

moves.name: Earth Power
moves.description: 10% chance to lower Special Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Earthquake
moves.description: Hits Pokemon using Dig with double Base Power.

moves.name: Facade
moves.description: Has 140 Base Power when burned, paralyzed, or poisoned.

moves.name: Flail
moves.description: Does more damage as HP decreases.

moves.name: Frustration
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Guard Swap
moves.description: Swaps Defense and Special Defense boosts and drops.

moves.description: Prevents anything from working on the user that turn.

moves.description: Summons rain for 5 turns.

moves.description: The user goes to sleep for two turns and restores all HP.

moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.description: Can hit if target is using Fly, Bounce, or Sky Drop. Ends target's airborne moves and its benefits from Flying type or Levitate.

moves.name: Snore
moves.description: Can only be used while sleeping. 30% chance to flinch.

moves.description: Damages foe's switch-ins.

moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Waterfall
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Withdraw
moves.description: Boosts Defense by 1 stage.

abilities.name: Solid Rock
abilities.description: Reduces damage from super effective hits by 1/4.

abilities.name: Sturdy
abilities.description: The weilder cannot be KO'd in one hit. OHKO moves will fail.
